name: Pineapple Bromeliad
description: Acanthostachys pitcairnioides is an epiphytic bromeliad native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil, Paraguay, and Argentina. It belongs to the Bromeliaceae family and features a rosette of stiff, spiny, gray-green leaves (7-10 cm long) arranged in a pineapple-like form. Many bromeliads form central water-holding rosettes (tanks) that create mini ecosystems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant displays an upright, rosette-forming growth habit and typically reaches 7-10 cm in height. In its native habitat, it grows as an epiphyte on tree trunks and branches in tropical forests. In terrariums or indoor settings, this plant adds natural beauty with its distinctive pineapple-like form. It's popular among bromeliad enthusiasts for its compact size and unique appearance.
